messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Mice vs Rats (Ren)
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 10/25/2002 4:50:23 PM Eastern Daylight Time, ... So why would it be that the feeder mice never acted this way, just the rats? I am not
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 10/25/2002 4:50:23 PM Eastern Daylight Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:
> Proabably because you are seeing feeder Rats, not hand fed breeder rats.
> They need to be handled and held from birth on to "socialize" them.
> Feeder rats get ignored, they're just going to end up in the belly of a
> snake
> anyway right?
>
> Ren
So why would it be that the feeder mice never acted this way, just the rats?
I am not trying to make any fuss I just want to make a good decision. Does
anyone know of a breeder in VA? Thanks! Lynn F


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
